item.title: Report X-2025061114
item.description:
Report X-2025061114

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-06
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A GROUND PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED DUE TO GETTING WET FROM RAIN. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (4) X 15 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF MICROBAN 24 HOUR SANITIZING SPRAY. THERE ARE NO MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER K100A6, AMAZON-MFN, 333 108TH AVE NE, BELLEVUE WA 98004-5703.

item.title: Report X-2025060568
item.description:
Report X-2025060568

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-06
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF stated they were unloading trailer 553002 they noticed 20 drums had resin on the inside of the shrink wrap and bottom of the drum. ABF stated they do not see an active leak however there is a substance on the inside of the shrink wrap and bottom of the drum. GES personnel inspected the spill-i mpacted 55-gallon drums of UN2922 and discovered that five (5) drums were transported with loose caps, which resulted in a release of approximately half (0.5) of a cup of material to the drums exteriors and trailer floor.

item.description:
Report X-2025060245

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-29
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR

  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING GROUND PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THREE AEROSOL CANS OF COFFEE TOPPERS COLD FOAM, EACH AT 15 OZ CAPACITY. ONE CAN HAD LEAKED CONTENTS FROM THE CLOSURE. THERE ARE NO APPLIED DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM TEXAS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER K100AG, MFN-AMAZON, 333 108TH AVE NE, BELLEVUE WA 98004-5703.

  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING GROUND PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THREE INNER CANS OF FLAMMABLE MILESI SELF-SEALER, EACH AT ONE GALLON CAPACITY. THE LIDS HAVE PAINT CLIPS. THE LID ON ONE OF THE CANS IS BENT WITH PRODUCT LEAKING FROM THE LID. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED WITHOUT ANY APPLIED DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Undeclared hazmat found during screening. Other undeclared hazmat found with no release as follows. (Replicating questions 14-29) UN1950, Aerosols, flammable//2.1// UN0012, Catrtridges, small arms// 1.4S//not shipped as hazardous waste//not toxic by inhalation//not shipped under Exemption, Approval, or CA number//shipment was undeclared with no release//packaging type non-bulk/outer packaging plastic box// No photos of the outer packaging. Found during screen. A known shipper with a known shipment which previously, moved via freighter aircraft.

item.description:
Report X-2025060262

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-14
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the PDXR location a shipment fell over and a large cloud of vaper was released. The shipment is suspected to be a dry dewar that wasn't drained for the liquid nitrogen. There were no DG markings or paperwork on the outer packaging that are required for transport. It was held for the FAA and then released.

item.title: Report E-2025050524
item.description:
Report E-2025050524

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-14
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1031 EST, ERTS was contacted by Jack Martin of XPO Logistics (UPO) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately .25 teaspoon of Oxidate 5.0 (hazardous - UN3109) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the shrink wrap only as condensation. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The vented cap was tightened on the jug and sent to the Consignee, and the impacted shrink wrap was paced into a 20-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately ¼ tsp of UN3109 Oxidate 5.0 product released due to improper loading. The contractors opened and placed the drum which XPO had created into a vented 55-gallon poly drum and submerged the impacted shrink wrap with water. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2025051965
item.description:
Report X-2025051965

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-09
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN PORTLAND, OREGON, WE RESPONDED TO ONE AIR PACKAGE DESTINED FOR GERMANY THAT WAS FOUND LEAKING. THE PACKAGE IS MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1993, FLAMMABLE LIQUID NOS WITH APPROPRIATE MARKS, LABELS, AND PAPERWORK FOR DANGEROUS GOODS. THE PACKAGE HAD PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN MEDFORD BUILDING, SLIC 9750 ON 09-MAY-2025. THE PACKAGE CONTAINS FOUR X ONE GALLON CONTAINERS OF CERAKOTE HC-603 ORAS BLACK. ONE GALLON HAS LEAKED AT LEAST HALF THE CONTENTS DUE TO A PUNCTURE IN THE CONTAINER. THE PACKAGE APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN CRUSHED IN THE BELT LOADER AT THE FACILITY. ALL CONTENTS HAVE BEEN DISPOSED OF PER NORMAL DANGEROUS GOODS DISPOSAL PROCEDURES.

item.title: Report X-2025051927
item.description:
Report X-2025051927

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-29
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Responded to report of Odor near tank car. Identified a release from the Liquid valve on "A" end of the tank car. Upon opening the housing compartment there was freezing indication around the valve body. The liquid valve was open, and the liquid plug was less than tool tight.
